     3  import (
     4  	"context"
     5  
     6  	"github.com/bnb-chain/greenfield-go-sdk/types"

     8  	"cosmossdk.io/math"
     9  	gnfdSdkTypes "github.com/bnb-chain/greenfield/sdk/types"
    10  	paymentTypes "github.com/bnb-chain/greenfield/x/payment/types"
    11  	sdk "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/types"
    12  	authTypes "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/x/auth/types"
    13  	bankTypes "github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/x/bank/types"
    14  )

    16  type Account interface {
    17  	GetAccount(ctx context.Context, address string) (authTypes.AccountI, error)
    18  	GetAccountBalance(ctx context.Context, address string) (*sdk.Coin, error)
    19  	GetPaymentAccount(ctx context.Context, address string) (*paymentTypes.PaymentAccount, error)
    20  	GetModuleAccounts(ctx context.Context) ([]authTypes.ModuleAccountI, error)
    21  	GetModuleAccountByName(ctx context.Context, name string) (authTypes.ModuleAccountI, error)
    22  	GetPaymentAccountsByOwner(ctx context.Context, owner string) ([]*paymentTypes.PaymentAccount, error)
    23  
    24  	CreatePaymentAccount(ctx context.Context, address string, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error)
    25  	Transfer(ctx context.Context, toAddress string, amount math.Int, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error)
    26  	MultiTransfer(ctx context.Context, details []types.TransferDetail, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error)
    27  }
    28  
    29  // GetAccount retrieves account information for a given address.
    30  // It takes a context and an address as input and returns an AccountI interface and an error (if any).
    31  func (c *client) GetAccount(ctx context.Context, address string) (authTypes.AccountI, error) {
    32  	accAddress, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(address)
    33  	if err != nil {
    34  		return nil, err
    35  	}
    36  	// Call the DefaultAccount method of the chain client with a QueryAccountRequest containing the address.
    37  	response, err := c.chainClient.Account(ctx, &authTypes.QueryAccountRequest{Address: accAddress.String()})
    38  	if err != nil {
    39  		// Return an error if there was an issue retrieving the account.
    40  		return nil, err
    41  	}
    42  
    43  	// Unmarshal the raw account data from the response into a BaseAccount object.
    44  	baseAccount := authTypes.BaseAccount{}
    45  	err = c.chainClient.GetCodec().Unmarshal(response.Account.GetValue(), &baseAccount)
    46  	if err != nil {
    47  		// Return an error if there was an issue unmarshalling the account data.
    48  		return nil, err
    49  	}
    50  
    51  	// Return the BaseAccount object as an AccountI interface.
    52  	return &baseAccount, err
    53  }
    54  
    55  // CreatePaymentAccount creates a new payment account on the blockchain using the provided address.
    56  // It returns a TxResponse containing information about the transaction, or an error if the transaction failed.
    57  func (c *client) CreatePaymentAccount(ctx context.Context, address string, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error) {
    58  	accAddress, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(address)
    59  	if err != nil {
    60  		return "", err
    61  	}
    62  	msgCreatePaymentAccount := paymentTypes.NewMsgCreatePaymentAccount(accAddress.String())
    63  	tx, err := c.chainClient.BroadcastTx(ctx, []sdk.Msg{msgCreatePaymentAccount}, &txOption)
    64  	if err != nil {
    65  		return "", err
    66  	}
    67  	return tx.TxResponse.TxHash, nil
    68  }
    69  
    70  func (c *client) GetModuleAccountByName(ctx context.Context, name string) (authTypes.ModuleAccountI, error) {
    71  	response, err := c.chainClient.ModuleAccountByName(ctx, &authTypes.QueryModuleAccountByNameRequest{Name: name})
    72  	if err != nil {
    73  		return nil, err
    74  	}
    75  	// Unmarshal the raw account data from the response into a BaseAccount object.
    76  	moduleAccount := authTypes.ModuleAccount{}
    77  	err = c.chainClient.GetCodec().Unmarshal(response.Account.GetValue(), &moduleAccount)
    78  	if err != nil {
    79  		// Return an error if there was an issue unmarshalling the account data.
    80  		return nil, err
    81  	}
    82  
    83  	// Return the BaseAccount object as an AccountI interface.
    84  	return &moduleAccount, err
    85  }
    86  
    87  func (c *client) GetModuleAccounts(ctx context.Context) ([]authTypes.ModuleAccountI, error) {
    88  	response, err := c.chainClient.ModuleAccounts(ctx, &authTypes.QueryModuleAccountsRequest{})
    89  	if err != nil {
    90  		return nil, err
    91  	}
    92  	var accounts []authTypes.ModuleAccountI
    93  	for _, accValue := range response.Accounts {
    94  		moduleAccount := authTypes.ModuleAccount{}
    95  		err = c.chainClient.GetCodec().Unmarshal(accValue.Value, &moduleAccount)
    96  		if err != nil {
    97  			// Return an error if there was an issue unmarshalling the account data.
    98  			return nil, err
    99  		}
   100  		accounts = append(accounts, &moduleAccount)
   101  	}
   102  	return accounts, err
   103  }
   104  
   105  // GetAccountBalance retrieves balance information of an account for a given address.
   106  // It takes a context and an address as input and returns an sdk.Coin interface and an error (if any).
   107  func (c *client) GetAccountBalance(ctx context.Context, address string) (*sdk.Coin, error) {
   108  	accAddress, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(address)
   109  	if err != nil {
   110  		return nil, err
   111  	}
   112  	response, err := c.chainClient.BankQueryClient.Balance(ctx, &bankTypes.QueryBalanceRequest{Address: accAddress.String(), Denom: gnfdSdkTypes.Denom})
   113  	if err != nil {
   114  		return nil, err
   115  	}
   116  
   117  	return response.Balance, nil
   118  }
   119  
   120  // GetPaymentAccount function takes a context and an address string as parameters and returns a pointer to a paymentTypes.PaymentAccount struct and an error.
   121  // This function uses the PaymentAccount method of the chainClient field of the client struct to query the payment account associated with the given address.
   122  // If there is an error, the function returns nil and the error. If there is no error, the function returns a pointer to the PaymentAccount struct and nil.
   123  func (c *client) GetPaymentAccount(ctx context.Context, address string) (*paymentTypes.PaymentAccount, error) {
   124  	accAddress, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(address)
   125  	if err != nil {
   126  		return nil, err
   127  	}
   128  	pa, err := c.chainClient.PaymentAccount(ctx, &paymentTypes.QueryGetPaymentAccountRequest{Addr: accAddress.String()})
   129  	if err != nil {
   130  		return nil, err
   131  	}
   132  	return &pa.PaymentAccount, nil
   133  }
   134  
   135  // GetPaymentAccountsByOwner retrieves all payment accounts owned by the given address
   136  // and returns a slice of PaymentAccount pointers and an error (if any).
   137  func (c *client) GetPaymentAccountsByOwner(ctx context.Context, owner string) ([]*paymentTypes.PaymentAccount, error) {
   138  	ownerAcc, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(owner)
   139  	if err != nil {
   140  		return nil, err
   141  	}
   142  	// Call the GetPaymentAccountsByOwner method of the chain client with a QueryGetPaymentAccountsByOwnerRequest containing the owner address.
   143  	accountsByOwnerResponse, err := c.chainClient.GetPaymentAccountsByOwner(ctx, &paymentTypes.QueryGetPaymentAccountsByOwnerRequest{Owner: ownerAcc.String()})
   144  	if err != nil {
   145  		return nil, err
   146  	}
   147  
   148  	// Initialize a slice of PaymentAccount pointers.
   149  	paymentAccounts := make([]*paymentTypes.PaymentAccount, 0, len(accountsByOwnerResponse.PaymentAccounts))
   150  
   151  	// Iterate over each account address returned in the response.
   152  	for _, accAddress := range accountsByOwnerResponse.PaymentAccounts {
   153  		// Call the GetPaymentAccount method of the client to retrieve the PaymentAccount object for the given address.
   154  		pa, err := c.GetPaymentAccount(ctx, accAddress)
   155  		if err != nil {
   156  			return nil, err
   157  		}
   158  		// Append the PaymentAccount object to the slice.
   159  		paymentAccounts = append(paymentAccounts, pa)
   160  	}
   161  
   162  	// Return the slice of PaymentAccount pointers.
   163  	return paymentAccounts, nil
   164  }
   165  
   166  // Transfer function takes a context, a toAddress string, an amount of type math.Int, and a txOption of
   167  // type gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption as parameters and returns a pointer to an sdk.TxResponse struct and an error.
   168  // This function first parses the toAddress parameter into an sdk.AccAddress object, and if there is an error,
   169  // it returns nil and the error.
   170  // Then it generates a MsgSend message using the NewMsgSend method of the types3 package and broadcasts the
   171  // transaction to the chain by calling the BroadcastTx method of the chainClient field of the client struct.
   172  // If there is an error during the broadcasting, the function returns nil and the error. If there is no error,
   173  // the function returns a pointer to the TxResponse struct and nil
   174  func (c *client) Transfer(ctx context.Context, toAddress string, amount math.Int, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error) {
   175  	toAddr, err := sdk.AccAddressFromHexUnsafe(toAddress)
   176  	if err != nil {
   177  		return "", err
   178  	}
   179  	msgSend := bankTypes.NewMsgSend(c.MustGetDefaultAccount().GetAddress(), toAddr, sdk.Coins{sdk.Coin{Denom: gnfdSdkTypes.Denom, Amount: amount}})
   180  	tx, err := c.chainClient.BroadcastTx(ctx, []sdk.Msg{msgSend}, &txOption)
   181  	if err != nil {
   182  		return "", err
   183  	}
   184  	return tx.TxResponse.TxHash, nil
   185  }
   186  
   187  // MultiTransfer makes transfers from an account to multiple accounts with respect amounts
   188  func (c *client) MultiTransfer(ctx context.Context, details []types.TransferDetail, txOption gnfdSdkTypes.TxOption) (string, error) {
   189  	outputs := make([]bankTypes.Output, 0)
   190  	denom := gnfdSdkTypes.Denom
   191  	sum := math.NewInt(0)
   192  	for i := 0; i < len(details); i++ {
   193  		outputs = append(outputs, bankTypes.Output{
   194  			Address: details[i].ToAddress,
   195  			Coins:   []sdk.Coin{{Denom: denom, Amount: details[i].Amount}},
   196  		})
   197  		sum = sum.Add(details[i].Amount)
   198  	}
   199  	in := bankTypes.Input{
   200  		Address: c.MustGetDefaultAccount().GetAddress().String(),
   201  		Coins:   []sdk.Coin{{Denom: denom, Amount: sum}},
   202  	}
   203  	msg := &bankTypes.MsgMultiSend{
   204  		Inputs:  []bankTypes.Input{in},
   205  		Outputs: outputs,
   206  	}
   207  	tx, err := c.chainClient.BroadcastTx(ctx, []sdk.Msg{msg}, &txOption)
   208  	if err != nil {
   209  		return "", err
   210  	}
   211  	return tx.TxResponse.TxHash, nil
   212  }
